question_text:
Question 60
 
 
The chromatic number of a graph is the minimum number of colours used in a proper colouring of the
graph. The chromatic number of the following graph is __________.
[Discrete Mathematics, 4 Graph Theory]
answer_text:
(2 to 2) 
Sol.

vertices in the second part.
A bipartite graph with at least 1 edge always has chromatic No. 2.
